attributes.action: Repeal the VED legislation Changes coming into force in April 2017
attributes.background: The proposed VED changes coming into force in April 2017 mean it is no longer an incentive to buy a low polluting car.
attributes.additional_details:
The new changes introduce the same basic charge on each subsequent year of ownership after the first year of ownership meaning if someone bought a 1 year old high polluting car they would pay the same tax as a 1 year old low polluting car removing the incentive to buy the economical car.

A much fairer system would be to move all of the band thresholds down so the emissions target for £0 VED is now 80g/km for example. And the 100g/km band now pays £30 a year and so on.

attributes.action: The National Curriculum to be run and controlled by an Education Council
attributes.background: Education has been used to sway voters for too long now. With each new Government comes a new National Curriculum. New 'ideas' or 'beliefs'. It's time for stability and for education to be in control of professionals and not politicians, by forming an Education Council of former Heads and teachers.
attributes.additional_details: Since 2010, the Education Department has been run by an accountant, a journalist, a solicitor and an economist. What qualifications do they have to decide on the best course of action for our children? The Government are too results driven. Schools should be places where children feel safe, where children go to enjoy learning, where children discover a passion for a given subject area. This is not happening under the current scrutiny from those who don't understand the education system.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all companies to recycle
attributes.background: Currently companies including large multinational ones such as macdonalds, cineworld and other industrial companies use plenty of material that is recyclable. However I have noticed that most don't offer the option to do so and most of this material ends up in landfill.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies open to the public should provide recycling stations where the discarded items can be separated into recyclable and non-recyclable waste. 
All businesses should manage their waste into these categories to help protect the environment for all life on earth.

attributes.action: Drivers of motor vehicles to use headlights at all times of the day and night.
attributes.background: Vehicles are often driven in poor light conditions. Vehicle colourings can make them nearly invisible against background colours. In daylight they can also be difficult to see. Compulsory headlights would make vehicles more visible and improve road safety. A no cost issue to motorists. A WIN WIN.

attributes.action: Cyclists should have legally registered identification plates on their cycles.
attributes.background: This is to enable identification of, and consequences for, cyclists who break road traffic laws and cause minor or major road incidents.
attributes.additional_details: There have been previous attempts to pass such laws but they have been generally tied in with the introduction of proposed insurance and road tax for cyclists.  Most cyclists, however, also own cars and so the concept of paying for road tax and insurance twice is an incredibly controversial one.  In order to keep this proposal straightforward, I am suggesting simply that cycle registration becomes compulsory in the same way car registration is, as a means of identification.

attributes.action: Solve the gridlock occuring on the M5 between Almondsbury & Clevedon.
attributes.background: Due to the design of the Avonmouth Bridge, the 3 mile long queues to leave the M5 at junction 19 (Portishead) both morning and evening, repeated accidents between junctions 18 and 19, in part due to road design, inpart due to careless driving, life on the M5 is now intolerable.
attributes.additional_details: One needs only reference Inrix, view CCTV or stand on a bridge to see the chaos and misery caused to locals, commuter, holiday makers and businesses. Now is the time to design a 2nd Avonmouth crossing, take local traffic for Portishead off at junction 18 (or use a design similar to J5-6, M20), bulldoze Gordano services, redesign junction 19, put in SMART motorway, widen the carriageways and if necessary re-route the motorway for long distance traffic from junction 15 to a new junction 19A.

attributes.action: Make the police non emergency number 101 a freephone number.
attributes.background: Currently the cost of calling 101 is 15p per call, yet the similar non emergency number of the NHS 111 is free, this needs to be resolved as most people in the UK use mobile phones and mostly on contracts where their minutes wouldn't cover the 15p charge to report a crime.

attributes.action: Back date money owed by HMRC to families with disabled children
attributes.background: HMRC has announced that it will only pay back money owed to families with disabled children for 2016/17. This is wrong. Families living day to day with the challenges of supporting a disabled child are themselves vulnerable. HMRC must repay all DLA tax credits owed to these families without delay.

attributes.action: To build a new Northern bypass around Ipswich
attributes.background: The Orwell Bridge has been closed in Ipswich all morning due to high winds, causing traffic chaos and gridlock in the town, it's about time a Northern bypass around Ipswich was built to defer the traffic from the town when the bridge is closed.
attributes.additional_details: It's 2016 and it's ridiculous that such a large town is so reliant on the bridge being open, as soon as there's an accident or bad weather, it's closed and the traffic has nowhere to go but through the town, which the infrastructure just cannot cope, costing businesses millions of pounds in lost revenue, especially haulage companies as they're reliant on the a14 to and from the port of felixstowe, get this Northern bypass built.

attributes.action: Diwali is Hindu festival and for lot of Hindu it is also their New year as well.
attributes.background: If Diwali is made as a National Holiday like Christmas then it will save Hindu people to use their holiday

attributes.action: A 2nd EU Referendum to be held with Compulsory Voting for the Eligible.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to Conduct a 2nd Referendum with Compulsory voting  for all who are eligible, with an abstention option on the ballot paper. This will give a true majority of the UK voters wishes regarding the EU and a true mandate to Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The British Election Study asked a question on whether people regretted how they voted or not. Only 1% of people who voted Remain said they regretted their vote, but 6% of people who voted Leave said they regretted their vote.

attributes.action: Stop all ivory trade from the UK and press for bans globally
attributes.background: Ivory collected after 1947 is currently illegal globally, however, Britain still exports legal Ivory to many countries such as Hong Kong, this  contributes greatly to the Ivory trade and can help salesmen conceal their illegal imports from across Africa, drastically harming elephant populations.

attributes.action: Allow existing annuities to be transferred into another existing private pension
attributes.background: Government has cancelled previous intention to allow annuities to be sold.

attributes.action: Invest more money into front line policing increase number of response officers
attributes.background:
More and more officers are being assaulted each year. With the lack of numbers it will soon become a huge safety issue. 

On top of that, too often we hear the story that response officers to not have the time, resources or funding to deal with/investigate an offence.
attributes.additional_details: 2015 saw a police officer assaulted every 22 minutes in England & Wales. This is a growing number and we need to invest to protect not only the public from these damaging cuts but the officers themselves.

attributes.action: Reinstate Postgraduate Loans To Other UK Citizens Living & Studying in England.
attributes.background: Appeal Against Student Finance England's decision to withdraw the funding of Scottish, Northern Irish and Welsh Postgraduate Students living and studying in England.
attributes.additional_details: The SFE waited until all the Scottish, Northern Irish and Welsh students living and studying in England had registered with their University before blocking their payments without any warning or notification. The SFE should be held accountable of how they have treated so many UK non-English nationals resulting in them with no funding and being forced off their studies. Is Student Finance England discriminating against UK citizens who are non-English Nationals from access to Higher Education?

attributes.action: Ban advertising of alcohol, restrict opening times, picture of damaged liver
attributes.background:
In September of this year my partner Claire died due to long term alcohol dependancy, more or less my last words to Claire was that I was going to try and help others in the same situation. 

Being alcohol dependant doesn't just effect the person it also effects close family and friends
attributes.additional_details:
What people don't realise is what damage drinking too much  alcohol can do, in many cases people with liver disease don't have any noticeable symptoms until their live is badly damaged. 
Those systems are.
Jaundice,Oadema, swelling in abdomen, itchy skin, weakness and muscle wasting,insomnia nose bleeds and bleeding gums.
To give you some figures on alcohol abuse it cost the NHS  £2000 per day for a level 3 patient on intensive care It is commonly said that it costs overall to the society £21 bn

attributes.action: Parliament must vote on initial aims of Brexit and then trigger Article 50.
attributes.background: The country voted 52:48 to leave the EU in June and to make Parliament sovereign in the UK. To be sovereign, Parliament must therefore be able to vote on and scrutinise the initial aims for Brexit negotiations and then vote to ensure article 50 is triggered, not leaving it to royal prerogative.
attributes.additional_details: In determining the starting point of Brexit, our elected representatives must have the chance to properly scrutinise and vote on the aims of the negotiations. MPs must engage with their constituents and all stakeholders to represent us, the people, in determining what the aims of Brexit should be. Our elected MPs should then vote to ensure article 50 is triggered so negotiations start following these aims set out by Parliament. To be truly sovereign, Parliament must play its full role in Brexit.

attributes.action: Allow full legal costs to be taken into account by the Child Support Agency
attributes.background: When one partner decides to breakup a relationship and leave, taking the children and denying the other partner an acceptable level of access and/or communication, the only recourse the other partner has to achieve reasonable access to their children is to take very costly legal action.
attributes.additional_details: Also, if despite paying a reasonable level of maintenance based on previous household bills, the leaving partner uses the CSA to obtain the maximum possible then paying the resultant determination can drain any available funds to pay for legal costs. This creates a very uneven playing field and therefore, full legal costs should be taken into consideration by the CSA in order that a parent can legally fight for their rights.

attributes.action: Stop decision to deny access to new medicines for those with ultra-rare diseases
attributes.background: NICE and NHS England’s decision to deny access to new medicines from 1 April 2017 for those suffering from ultra-rare diseases, is about to change the lives of thousands of vulnerable, ill people all over England. Medical treatments will be denied, thus condemning those affected to an early death.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.mpssociety.org.uk/2017/03/28/press-release-nice-nhs-englands-decision-deny-access-new-medicines-no-april-fools-joke/
This is specific to MPS and related diseases, but there are many other ultra-rare diseases within England which also be affected, this petition is to cover all of these diseases. This petition is not to condemn the whole proposal made by NICE and NHS, but to amend decisions within it, mainly the access to new medicines.
More information can be found via the NICE website

attributes.action: Give convicted pedophiles a minimum jail term of 20 years
attributes.background: I am so concerned by the lack of jail term time pedophiles receive after committing horrendous crimes against young children. Other crimes such as drug dealing and armed robbery, whilst still awful crimes, receive a much higher custodial sentence- why? I believe there should be a minimum term set.
attributes.additional_details:
After working in schools for over 15 years I have seen first hand the effect this horrendous crimes have on young children. It stays with them all their lives yet the animal that committed it will be out of jail in usually less than 2 years. It has become the norm for a paedophilia to recieve low term times - why? But we just let it happen? Well I'm not anymore. 
I've once wrote to a judge over a low jail term and he replied it was the government who term the time - let's make them change it!

attributes.action: Overseas Aid only spendable in the UK. Only send things abroad not cash.
attributes.background: Aid is desperately needed by the poor and disadvantaged of the world. Aid that is given by us but often never reaches the people who need it. This petition provides an answer to that problem
attributes.additional_details: By publishing where aid is given and in what form, the people of the UK, whose money is at present being woefully inadequately spent, can see, online, just where their money is going

attributes.action: Mandatory weekly hour classes in current politics in secondary schools.
attributes.background: Give secondary school children a chance to learn about the different parties in the UK and their policies (etc) from an unbiased perspective. Learn about current affairs both locally and abroad, voting etc. Give everyone the right to unbiased knowledge to make well informed decisions as adults.
attributes.additional_details: I propose hour classes once a week in order to keep children engaged and updated. Teach the requirements for voting, the process of voting, current party policies for each party, practice voting etc. Engage in current debates and learn of foreign affairs that affect both the UK and the world. Allow them the advantage of awareness when coming to the voting age for both fair and thoroughly considered decisions. Studying Holocaust Literature in my degree has inspired me to propose this.

attributes.action: Make 'Up To' internet package speeds illegal.
attributes.background: 'Up To' internet speed packages plague the UK market and are used as an instant 'get out of jail free card' if the companies oversell or over promise on what customers are expecting. Customers are not able to accurately compare speeds and often receive much lower than is stated.
attributes.additional_details:
Internet packages are often sold as 'Up To' speeds. A package 'Up to 100MBps' may in fact regularly provide 8MBps (8% of the expected speed). The Government should either:
A) Require the speed received to be no less than 80% of the speed advertised, (example "100MBps", min acceptable 80MBps)
Or
B) Force companies to sell at the minimal acceptable speed, (example "From 80MBps").
If the speed paid for is not met for more than 1 hour the customer should not have to pay for that days costs.

attributes.action: There should be a legislation for all hospitals to have post-pay parking system.
attributes.background: When in A&E, so many times you either pay a lot more than the time you actually use the car park. If you pay less, you either have to keep going back to extend parking or you will get a Parking charge notice. It is so unfair for hospitals to charge money for time when parking is not used
attributes.additional_details: When going to A&E you don't know how long you will be waiting before being seen by a consultant. So many times you either pay a lot more than the time you actually use the car park. If you pay less, you either have to keep going back to extend parking or you will get a Parking charge notice. It is so unfair for hospitals to charge money from you for the time you are not even using the parking. A system with ANPR where you only pay for the time you have used the parking will be fairer.

attributes.action: Introduce Nutrition as a core subject to the National Curriculum
attributes.background: With the ongoing and ever increasing obesity epidemic, young people need to be educated in how to keep their bodies healthy from an early age. By educating them and getting them excited about food and nutrition, I hope that we can help to solve this crisis.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015/16 the National Child Measurement Programme revealed that 19.8% of children in Year 6 were obese and a further 14.3% were overweight. Overweight and obese children are likely to become overweight adults and continue to have an increased risk of developing various physical, emotional and psychological problems. The government needs to act now to help solve this crisis by educating the young people of the UK so they are fully informed of how to keep themselves healthy.

attributes.action: Restore the Hereditary Peers and Appellate Committee to the House of Lords.
attributes.background: The House of Lords is no longer independent of the political parties in the House of Commons, leading to the destruction of the British Parliamentary system. We have lost Liberty and Justice because of this. To correct this we must restore the Hereditary Peers and Appellate Committee in the Lords.
attributes.additional_details: We are now leaving the EU, so we should set about restoring the institutions of the British state, which the EU has undermined with the support the political parties in the House of Commons. The House of Lords should be a House of legacy and law, a check on the power of political parties and the government. The political parties should no longer be able to stack the House to block the will of the British people.

attributes.action: Make St. David's day (March 1st) a public holiday in Wales
attributes.background: I believe that St. David's day should be a public holiday for the Welsh. This was declined by Tony Blair in the past even though a majority (87%!) Wanted the change.

attributes.action: Protect Freeholders from fraud by estate management companies.
attributes.background: Freeholders currently don't enjoy the same protection as leaseholders from unjustified estate charges. They are currently open to widespread and systematic fraud and some so called “estate management companies” are taking full advantage of this.
attributes.additional_details:
In all cases, regardless of whether it is freeholders or leaseholders who are being charged these fees…

It must be made a requirement that all fees pass the test of “reasonableness” and are backed by proper documentation.

Arbitrary unspecified “management fees” should be banned as I believe they already are in Scotland.

attributes.action: I want you to to make it law that all Cats & Kittens to be microchipped.
attributes.background: With so many Cats being killed in road traffic accidents, then being discarded by most councils as waste. Many people want to know what has happened to their pet, whether killed in a road accident or lost.

attributes.action: Make it maditory for people over 60 to take a driving test every 5 years
attributes.background: Although evidence does suggest that most accidents are caused by 17-24 year old drivers, it is well known that the human body isnt as quick to respond as it was when you are younger. I propose it is about time we had a manditory test for those over the age of 60 every 5 years to reduce deaths.
attributes.additional_details: In 2011, there were 10,974 accidents involving elderly drivers over the age of 70.

attributes.action: Review VED switch to mileage based tax system
attributes.background: For years we have been paying road tax on a fixed rate system. This is old out dated. Punishing those who barely use the roads while those who abuse them barley cover the damage they cause.
attributes.additional_details: Allowing those who do extreme amounts of mileage to pay the same rate as those who barely use the road is unfair. I personally fall into both catagories. I do approx 50k a year for work and less than 2k in my own personal vehicle. Yet i pay more tax for my personal vehicle than my company does for the vehicle doing x25 the mileage. monitor fuel usage when you register a car. You get a fuel card u swipe everytime you fill up (similar to a company fuel card) to prevent tampering. No card no fuel.

attributes.action: Introduce and enforce a trade embargo on Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia have an appalling human rights record. Homosexual acts are punishable by death and women are treated legally as second class citizens. In addition to their medieval society, there is evidence that the Saudi regime funds Sunni terrorists organisations. We cannot do business with them.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/saudi-arabia/local-laws-and-customs
"The Saudi legal system differs in many ways from the UK. Suspects can be held without charge and are not always allowed quick access to legal representation. The Saudi authorities have detained witnesses and victims of crimes."
"It is illegal for women to drive."
"The public practice of any form of religion other than Islam is illegal"

attributes.action: Stop married personnel paying for own home and camp accommodation
attributes.background: Currently the army charges married personnel for camp accommodation if they own a permenant family home until they over the age of 37
attributes.additional_details: I'm currently serving in the British Army attached to the Navy, as I bought my own home I have to commute every weekend. Within the navy married personnel who own and live in a house do not require to pay for camp accommodation. But Army policy you have to pay for accommodation until you are 37 which I believe is unfair.  As the reason why serving members need the accommodation is to allow them a place to sleep and administrate whilst away from their personal home.

attributes.action: Ban the importation and distribution of all dyed fish.
attributes.background: Dyeing fish is completely unatural and inhumane. Fish that have been injected with these dyes suffer a dramatically shortened life span and are much more susceptible to infection and disease. It is said that in most cases only 50% of fish actually survive the procedure.
attributes.additional_details: Reference - http://www.pets4homes.co.uk/pet-advice/the-phenomenon-of-dyed-fish-and-how-to-avoid-it.html

attributes.action: Cut the foreign aid budget, and use the funds to fix potholes on UK roads.
attributes.background: U.K roads have been seriously neglected by UK governments to the point of being dangerous for road users. Foreign aid should be cut to pay for urgently needed repairs. An annual online audit should be produced for public scrutiny, showing total road tax revenue, and how this money is being spent.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on abolishing the British Monarchy
attributes.background: Currently, Britain has an unelected Head of State who is unelected and unaccountable. The Queen has rule over all laws that are made in the UK, but doesn't even help make them in the first place. She has consistently shown a lack of any leadership; recently in regards to Donald Trump's state visit.
attributes.additional_details: The Queen has to pass every law made and has the power to veto them. This is not democracy, this is proof that Britain is stuck in the past and desperately needs modernisation. After Britain voted to leave the EU, it is clear that we no longer want people who are unelected ruling over us. A referendum, whatever result is produced, will give the Queen a mandate to leave or lead; it is time to take back democracy.

attributes.action: Modify the petition system to force Parliament debate of >100,000 signatures
attributes.background:
The present UK Government and Parliament petition system states that 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be considered for debate in Parliament."

This appears to be deliberately vague about who, and on what criteria, fair consideration will be given.

Remove "considered for"
attributes.additional_details:
The present UK Government and Parliament petition system states that 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be considered for debate in Parliament."

This appears to be deliberately vague about who, and on what criteria, fair consideration will be given.

Rewrite as 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be debated in Parliament."

attributes.action: Bring back the YTS scheme for the many small businesses.
attributes.background: I am a blacksmith (I am 54), i would love to pass on my skills and keep teach a young person the ropes, however as a small business myself, we just break even as i have invested all our profit into new equipment, i looked into having an apprentice and its currently impossible

attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke in the uk for everyone born after 2020 Save our kids.
attributes.background:
Cigarette smoking harms nearly every organ of the body, causes many diseases, and reduces the health of smokers in general.1,2
Quitting smoking lowers your risk for smoking-related diseases and can add years to your life.
attributes.additional_details:
Nhs loses tax revenue from lost productivity when people are made ill by smoking. Conditions caused by smoking cost the NHS billions.
The cost of treating smokers in England was estimated at £2.7 billion in 2006. And that was 10 years ago just think how much it costs the NHS now

attributes.action: Make the day we leave the EU a national holiday within the United Kingdom!
attributes.background: I believe the day the announcement is made stating that The United Kingdom has full left the EU we should have that date as a United Kingdom Bank Holiday and should be a day of reflection of how strong we are as a small country! 'National Brexit Day'!

attributes.action: Give the people of the UK a veto (by referendum) of any trade deal
attributes.background:
The withdrawal of the UK from the EU will leave us in a position where unsafe trade deals could be made threatening the sovereignty of the UK over governance and standards of products and services.
The people of the UK need a deciding voice in any deal before it is enacted

attributes.action: Include MPs from all political parties in the negotiations team for Brexit
attributes.background: The negotiated results will be permanent and are too important to be subject to party politics.  Approaches to strategy and policy could be designed to make sure no one party would be able to obstruct the process. It would help to re-unite the UK and lead to a better outcome for all of us.

attributes.action: Make the licencing fee for the BBC optional.
attributes.background: The BBC has an obvious left wing agenda, I don't watch the BBC but because I have the ability to receive it, forces me to pay for it, Surely in this age of technology it can be a "Pay per view" channel.

attributes.action: Change the law from late miscarriage to stillbirth.
attributes.background: I myself have had a stillbirth at 34 weeks just 9 month ago and I was outraged to discover that any children born before 24 weeks are categorised as a miscarriage. I want this changed.
attributes.additional_details: Many people don't realise that at this time the mother must give birth to their baby which is often fully formed. They hold them, love them and name them and yet they are non existent is the eyes of the law. They will not be offered a birth or death certificate or a funeral. This is heart breaking for the parents and family. I would like the law changed from miscarriage to still birth from the day any mother has to physically give birth to a baby.

attributes.action: Stop outsourcing assessments for PIP and make fit for Mental Health sufferers.
attributes.background: The current assessment trivialises common issues like depression and anxiety and does not take these into consideration when deciding these claims. The form and the assessor only consider physical ailments and not how mental ability often prevent physical ability and is tantamount to discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: ATOS Healthcare also often misrepresent an individuals needs and conversations they have had during PIP assessments and this has been well documented in the press and many websites previously. Here are a couple of examples: http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/new-claims-of-atos-assessment-lies-are-tip-of-a-massive-iceberg/ and http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/atos-nurse-lied-about-pip-claimant-attending-assessment-alone/

attributes.action: give expats the vote in future referendums
attributes.background: I am petitioning to give expats from the UK the vote in any future referendum in the UK.

attributes.action: Impose minimum standards for UK phone network providers to meet.
attributes.background: Having tried several networks over the years I found that non of our providers can supply a minimum standard phone signal across Norfolk, yet we are now being told about 5G most of us bearly get signal for a call or text or 2G. Our phones are for our safety and with no signal we are not safe.

attributes.action: Ban strikes 1 week before and after the top 10 designated 'peak use' times p/a
attributes.background:
Striking should not be targeted at consumers. 

As strikes cite reasons such as 'safety' for their end purposes, there is no legitimate reason to arrange strikes around the busiest / highest consumer use times. 

This petition would stop consumer suffering whilst still protecting workers rights.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence in plentiful supply today, looking at post offices, airports, trains etc.

attributes.action: Make it 'illegal' to setup None Legal Encampment's, with the Police given Powers
attributes.background:
The Police must be given the Powers to Remove people as they Arrive, it should not be for the Councils and Land Owners to Waste money taking Action, also any Mess/Damage must be got from the ones who caused it like breaking in, and Human Waste.
At this time it is Unfair that Council Money is Waste
attributes.additional_details:
Some in the Traveling sector cause issues with Locals, Fly Tip, our council plus the City council have had to pay out good money in Repairs with one area which a school uses closed for eight days cleaning up their mess and repairs to the grass area, another they lifted out posts to a play area, cut chains on gates Only to be moved on to do the same again, No Law in this practice.

Let's make the Laws apply to All.

attributes.action: Increase Employee National Insurance by 1%
attributes.background: Increase Employee National Insurance by 1% to be used exclusively for the NHS & Social Care. With the NHS and Social Care in turmoil both facing unprecedented funding shortages, it is time for the UK workforce to help further fund these services.
attributes.additional_details: Polling has shown that 48% would support a 1% increase in national insurance contributions to go towards the NHS and Social Care.
